Title: Most capacity offered at Italy's Piombino LNG import terminal allocated
Description: Over 86% of the capacity offered at Italy's 5 bn m3 Piombino LNG import terminal set to start operations in early May has been allocated. Piombino is one of the three floating terminals Italy is launching between now and October 2024 and which will double the country's import capacity.
Author: DE

Title: Strike action reduces capacity at France's Dunkerque LNG terminal
Description: Strike action will cut delivery capacity at France's largest LNG import terminal, 9.6 mtpa Dunkerque, on Mar. 23. Meanwhile, the country's three other terminals remain shut down until Mar. 28. France has already lost over 1 mt of LNG supplies since the start of the strike with losses potentially rising to 1.3 mt.
Author: DE

Title: Germany's Brunsbuttel LNG terminal starts feeding gas into German grid
Description: Germany's third LNG import terminal in Brunsbuttel started feeding regasified LNG into the German grid on Mar. 22 after facing delays for about two months. Germany heavily relies on the smooth launch of seven such floating LNG terminals to help replace its lost Russian pipeline supplies as fast as possible.
Author: DE

Title: France's LNG supply losses could rise to 1.3 mt amid strike extension
Description: France has already lost over 1 mt of LNG supplies since the strike action started on Mar. 6 and losses could further rise to a total of 1.3 mt. Five more LNG cargos have been diverted away from France to other European terminals and another three planned deliveries could also be rerouted or delayed as three of France's four LNG terminals have extended their strike-led halt in operations for a third week.
Author: DE

Title: India’s BPCL issues first LNG tender for the year amid price drop, seeks April cargo
Description: India’s state-owned oil refiner BPCL has issued its first spot tender for the year to buy one LNG cargo for delivery on Apr. 24 to the 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal in India’s western state of Gujarat. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Russia expects to significantly increase gas and LNG supplies to China by 2030
Description: Russia expects to significantly expand its supplies of pipeline gas and LNG to China, adding to existing contractual commitments for supplies from the Power of Siberia 1 gas pipeline and the 17.4 mtpa Yamal LNG plant.
Author: CK
